posts.post_text: May 15, 2022 at 6:13 AM#1hi everyone：How to quickly delete  sequences that is not assginned to  executors?

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: May 15, 2022 at 5:08 PM#2HiA workaround is to build a sequence with each cue having a command : delete seq #ex : cue 1 cmd="del seq  1"cue 2 cmd="del seq 2"etcRun your sequence, at the end the confirmation pop-up will appear"objects are in use, do you want to delete ?"Hit EscapeAll unassigned sequences are deleted, the assigned ones aren't.Exemple of macro to create the sequence :Macro 'unused sequences"1.Setvar $fseq = (first sequence to scan ?)2.Setvar $lseq = (last seq to scan ?)3.Setvar $range = $lseq; addvar $range = -$fseq4.Store Seq 999 cue 1 thru $range /o5.Assign Seq 999 cue 2 thru /trig=follow6.Setvar $cue = 17.Setvar $cmd = "del seq "; addvar $cmd = $fseq8.Assign seq 999 cue $cue /cmd=$"cmd"9.addvar $cue = 1; Addvar $fseq = 110.[$fseq<=$lseq] macro 1.'unused sequences".711.Go Seq 99912. Delete seq 999 /nc
